meanings.definition: Having lived for a long time; old.
meanings.sent1: The aged tree stood tall in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The aged man shared stories of his youth.
meanings.sent3: The aged cat refused to chase mice, claiming it was too tired.
meanings.sent4: The aged book's pages were yellowed with time.
meanings.sent5: The aged house creaked with every step.

meanings.definition: Showing the effects of time or wear.
meanings.sent1: Her aged shoes had holes in the soles.
meanings.sent2: The aged car had rust spots on its exterior.
meanings.sent3: The aged clock ticked loudly, as if protesting its age.
meanings.sent4: The aged photograph had faded, losing its colors.
meanings.sent5: The aged furniture was scratched and scuffed from use.

meanings.sent1: The aged wine was over 50 years old.
meanings.sent2: The aged students were all in their forties.
meanings.sent3: The aged cheese had a sharp flavor that surprised many.
meanings.sent4: The aged building was constructed in the 1800s.
meanings.sent5: The aged painting was dated back to the Renaissance period.
